organic_results.title: Who goes where? Choice of single-sex and coeducational independent secondary schools
organic_results.snippet: Whether families and students choose single-sex over coeducational schools for traditional reasons or because they value these schools as opportunity structures is the focus of this study. In the United States, where single-sex education is an option only in the private sector, most research on this organizational form has focused on Catholic schools. Introducing a new population to single-sex school research, this sample consists of the entire 1989 senior class (3,183 students) in each of 60 secondary schools selected as a …
